content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Pick the best new idea and actually WRITE the code to implement it as a new PopeBot skill in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). Write and execute a test to prove it works. Use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a progress report detailing what you built, how you implemented it, your test results, and code samples so the user can review it at 8 AM.

content.thinking:
The user wants me to:
1. Scan three GitHub repositories for new tools, skills, and architectures
2. Pick the best new idea
3. Implement it as a new PopeBot skill in the .pi/skills/ directory
4. Write and execute a test to prove it works
5. Email a progress report to winsorllc@yahoo.com

Let me start by exploring the repositories. I'll need to use the browser-tools skill or bash with git to clone and explore these repos.

Let me start by cloning these repositories to explore them.

content.text: I'll scan these three repositories for innovative ideas, implement the best one as a new skill, test it, and email you a progress report. Let me start by exploring the repositories.

content.thinking: The clone is happening. Let me wait for it to complete and then clone the other two repos.
Let me wait for the clones to complete and then explore the repositories.
Good, all three repos are cloned. Now let me explore their structures to find interesting tools, skills, and architectures.
